dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news this week, uh, President-elect Biden, he's planning to nominate Janet Yellen for Treasury Secretary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news this week, uh, President-elect Biden, he's planning to nominate Janet Yellen for Treasury Secretary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen to become the next Treasury Secretary, the Wall Street Journal first reported Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that! I mean, that's a pretty significant pick, especially right now with, like, everything going on with the economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that! I mean, that's a pretty significant pick, especially right now with, like, everything going on with the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. She's gonna be facing, you know, this massive task of stabilizing the American economy, which is, uh, just reeling from the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. She's gonna be facing, you know, this massive task of stabilizing the American economy, which is, uh, just reeling from the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If she is nominated and confirmed, Yellen will be faced with the task of stabilizing an American economy that is reeling from the effects of the coronavirus pandemic amid ongoing gridlock over stimulus legislation in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the gridlock! Don't forget that. I mean, stimulus legislation is still, like, a huge fight in Washington.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the gridlock! Don't forget that. I mean, stimulus legislation is still, like, a huge fight in Washington.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes seen as a middle-of-the-road pick: conservative enough for Republicans but liberal enough for Democrats.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But she's seen as kind of a middle-of-the-road pick, which is interesting, right? Like, conservative enough for Republicans, but liberal enough for Democrats.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But she's seen as kind of a middle-of-the-road pick, which is interesting, right? Like, conservative enough for Republicans, but liberal enough for Democrats.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes seen as a middle-of-the-road pick: conservative enough for Republicans but liberal enough for Democrats.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Biden said he wanted someone acceptable to all elements of the Democratic party, from progressives to moderates. And, uh, Yellen, she really fits that bill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Biden said he wanted someone acceptable to all elements of the Democratic party, from progressives to moderates. And, uh, Yellen, she really fits that bill.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last week, Biden said that his pick for Treasury Secretary would be someone who will be accepted by all elements of the Democratic Party, from the progressive to the moderate coalitions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: She's a big supporter of financial regulation, like Dodd-Frank, but she's not, um, seen as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She's a big supporter of financial regulation, like Dodd-Frank, but she's not, um, seen as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen is a supporter of financial regulation, including the Dodd-Frank legislation introduced in 2010 to reform the banking system after the financial crisis, but she isnt viewed as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And she's also been pushing for more stimulus measures, which is, you know, critical right now for the economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And she's also been pushing for more stimulus measures, which is, you know, critical right now for the economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes also pushed for additional stimulus measures during the coronavirus crisis, telling Bloomberg TV last month that we need support for the economy from both monetary and fiscal policy in addition to more effective public health measures to control the virus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And here's the kicker, folks: if she's confirmed, she'll be the first woman to serve as Treasury Secretary. She was already the first woman to lead the Fed, too!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And here's the kicker, folks: if she's confirmed, she'll be the first woman to serve as Treasury Secretary. She was already the first woman to lead the Fed, too!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen was the first woman to lead the U.S. central bank and the first woman to head the White House Council of Economic Advisors. If she is nominated and confirmed by the Senate as Treasury Secretary, shell also be the first woman to serve in that role.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow, that's huge! [interrupts] And speaking of her time at the Fed, remember why Trump, uh, didn't reappoint her?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow, that's huge! And speaking of her time at the Fed, remember why Trump, uh, didn't reappoint her?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Oh my gosh, yes! The Post reported he thought she wasn't tall enough! She's, like, five feet tall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! The Post reported he thought she wasn't tall enough! She's, like, five feet tall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Washington Post reported that year that Trumps advisors had encouraged him to choose his own appointee for the job, and that Trump had expressed concerns to aides that Yellen was not tall enough to run the U.S. central bank (she is 5 feet tall), the Post reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, really? That's, uh, that's just wild. What an excuse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, really? That's, uh, that's just wild. What an excuse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. But, you know, she's got this incredible background, head of the San Francisco Fed, Vice Chair, then Chair.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. But, you know, she's got this incredible background, head of the San Francisco Fed, Vice Chair, then Chair.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen has also served as the head of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco as well as the Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve. She was appointed by President Obama to head the Federal Reserve in 2014, and was succeeded by Jerome Powell in 2018 after President Trump declined to reappoint her when her term ended.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she's certainly got the resume. And, you know, Robert Reich, he tweeted that she's "not @SenWarren but she's not from the Street" either, which I thought was a pretty good summary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she's certainly got the resume. And, you know, Robert Reich, he tweeted that she's not at Sen Warren but she's not from the Street either, which I thought was a pretty good summary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Reich, who served as Secretary of Labor in the Clinton administration, cheered Bidens pick. Shes not @SenWarren but shes not from the Street, he wrote on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a great quote. And this is part of a larger slate of, uh, pretty significant hires Biden's making for his administration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a great quote. And this is part of a larger slate of, uh, pretty significant hires Biden's making for his administration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden has already lined up a number of high profile hires for his new administration. On Monday he announced his intention to nominate Avril Haines as the the first female Director of National Intelligence and Alejandro Mayorkas as the first Latino head of the Department of Homeland Security.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It really shows the direction he's trying to take. It'll be interesting to see how she navigates everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It really shows the direction he's trying to take. It'll be interesting to see how she navigates everything.
